items.text: gave himself room and slaps this past point for a couple. Too short and turning away from the left-hander, which makes the stroke very much on
items.shortText: Chase to Shakib Al Hasan, 2 runs

items.text: steps away again, but Chase bowls it fuller and loops it more. Shakib ends up reaching for it and sends it in the air, but his placement has been good so far and it's in the gap at cover
items.shortText: Chase to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run

items.text: loses his line to go too far down leg and it's a wide
items.shortText: Chase to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 wide

items.text: tossed up outside off, he defends watchfully from the crease
items.shortText: Chase to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: reverse sweep premeditated it almost, and took advantage of Chase's off stump line to send it over short third man and into the boundary
items.shortText: Chase to Mushfiqur Rahim, FOUR runs

items.preText: Bangladesh are purring at the moment. Need only 70 more from 26 overs
items.text: good length outside off, punched through cover
items.shortText: Roach to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run

items.text: too full, clipped off his toes, but straight to mid-on
items.shortText: Roach to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: digs it in short but loses his line, goes well down the leg side and another wide. West Indies, and Roach particularly, have been very sloppy with extras
items.shortText: Roach to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 wide

items.text: dug it in short again, and that took off from a length, moved off the seam too and went wide of Mushfiqur's shoulder. Another wide
items.shortText: Roach to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 wide

items.text: adding insult to injury another short ball but outside off that time. Mushfiqur slashed it, it takes the top edge and goes right over where slips would have been and into the fence. Even if a slip was in place it was too high to catch
items.shortText: Roach to Mushfiqur Rahim, FOUR runs

items.text: fuller length outside off, steered to third man
items.shortText: Roach to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

items.text: too full and Shakib drives it straight back. Didn't have great timing but it was bullet straight and had enough legs to reach the boundary before the fielders got there
items.shortText: Roach to Shakib Al Hasan, FOUR runs

items.text: length ball angling into the pads, tickled to square leg. That's also the 50-run partnership
items.shortText: Roach to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run

items.text: gives himself room, there is extra bounce and turn on the ball, and Shakib adjusts and plays it fine to the keeper's left. Half intentional edge
items.shortText: Chase to Shakib Al Hasan, 2 runs

items.preText: Slip comes in as a result of that last shot
items.text: big turn and beaten while going for the big drive
items.shortText: Chase to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

items.text: comes forward to defend
items.shortText: Chase to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

items.text: backs away considerably, and Chase follows him, the ball goes under his bat off the attempted slash.
items.shortText: Chase to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

items.text: stays in his crease that time and is able to get down and sweep it to deep midwicket
items.shortText: Chase to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run

items.preText: Surya: "The only way windies are going to win this is by giving Thomas a burst now and hope he will runs through. unless they feel he needs a rest which is worrying . "
items.text: tossed up considerably, ends up too full and Mushfiqur strokes it through cover. Timed well enough to just beat the fielder to the boundary
items.shortText: Chase to Mushfiqur Rahim, FOUR runs

items.preText: Prathamesh: "@saurabh - Is this a record of the number of extras(or wides particularly) been conceded by a fielding team??" - far from it. I don't know the record but in 1999, India gave up 51 extras against Zimbabwe in the World Cup, if memory serves me right
items.text: nicks one behind good length, angling across Shakib who stepped down and wanted to send this into the sightscreen. Ends up feathering it behind
items.shortText: R Powell to Shakib Al Hasan, OUT

dismissal.text: Shakib Al Hasan c †Hope b R Powell 30 (26b 4x4 0x6) SR: 115.38

items.preText: Mahneel: "Would it be far fetched to say that Bangladesh is the second best ODI team in Asia?" - not far-fetched, given that they beat Pakistan in the Asia Cup. But here comes Soumya Sarkar, unfamiliar position at No.6 but Bangladesh are well set despite Shakib's wicket
items.text: good length on the stumps, he comes on the front foot and drives gently to mid-off. Darren Bravo fields and hits direct, but Mushfiqur had come back in time
items.shortText: R Powell to Soumya Sarkar, no run

items.text: good length on the stumps, defended back to the bowler
items.shortText: R Powell to Soumya Sarkar, no run

items.text: pops up in the air, but safe angled across him again and Sarkar gives in to the temptation to throw bat at it. Too early into the shot and it goes in the air, but over cover and safe
items.shortText: R Powell to Soumya Sarkar, 2 runs

items.text: went in the air again, but more in control than the last ball. Drove it on the up, and over mid-off to get a boundary
items.shortText: R Powell to Soumya Sarkar, FOUR runs

items.text: he's forced the bowler to alter his length, and he picks off this full ball to mid-on with a nice flick
items.shortText: R Powell to Soumya Sarkar, 1 run
